content: The Act titled "Higher Education Affordability and Equity Act of 2007" expands the deduction for interest on education loans. The "Higher Education Affordability and Equity Act of 2007" expands the deduction for interest on education loans by repealing the dollar limitation and increasing the phaseout beginning point based on modified adjusted gross income. The "Higher Education Affordability and Equity Act of 2007" expands the deduction for interest on education loans by increasing the phaseout beginning point based on modified adjusted gross income. The "Higher Education Affordability and Equity Act of 2007" increases the deduction for interest on education loans by adjusting the phaseout beginning point based on modified adjusted gross income. The amendment also raises the $100,000 and $200,000 amounts in subsection (b) for taxable years beginning after 2008. The effective date for these changes is after December 31, 2007. SEC. 3. Deduction for qualified tuition and related expenses made permanent. Amendment to Internal Revenue Code of 1986 by striking subsection (e). Effective date for this amendment is for taxable years beginning after December 31, 2007. SEC. 4. Education savings accounts. SEC. 4. EDUCATION SAVINGS ACCOUNTS. Increase in allowable contributions to $5,000. Reports must be filed by June 30 of the following year. Effective date for amendments is taxable years beginning after December 31, 2007. SEC. 5. Allowance of room, board, and special needs services for scholarships and tuition reduction programs in higher education. In amendments to the Internal Revenue Code of 1986, qualified scholarship definitions are expanded to include qualified higher education expenses for enrollment at eligible educational institutions. The terms 'qualified higher education expenses' and 'eligible educational institution' are defined in section 529(e). Special rules for teaching and research assistants regarding tuition reduction programs are also modified. The amendments to the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 expand qualified scholarship definitions to include qualified higher education expenses for enrollment at eligible educational institutions. Special rules for teaching and research assistants regarding tuition reduction programs are also modified, with changes effective for expenses paid after December 31, 2007. SEC. 6. Expansion of educational expenses allowed as part of Hope Scholarship Credit. Expansion of qualified tuition and related expenses for the Hope Scholarship Credit to include fees, books, supplies, and equipment required for courses at eligible educational institutions. Pell Grants and Supplemental Educational Opportunity Grants will not reduce the Hope Scholarship Credit. Amendments made to sections regarding Pell Grants and SEOG grants for the Hope Scholarship Credit and information reporting requirements. Amendments to section 6050S of the Code expand qualified tuition expenses for the Hope Scholarship Credit. Effective date is after December 31, 2007, for education in academic periods starting after that date. Title IX of the Economic Growth and Tax Relief Reconciliation Act of 2001 exempts subtitles A, B, and D of title IV from the sunset provisions.
